channel.title: Why is this always happening to me?
channel.description: I used to run a RSPS and it was fairly well, but then after awhile and still today, I run the source and client and log in.. And I just like, can't code I start to like.. Stress out? Or i'm like "Fuck It" and it just feels like it always.. I tried taking breaks but this has been happening for months... Anyone have any idea why I just cant be asked to code anymore? I want to, but its liike a force is stopping me from doing so.

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Krim:

I just watch My Little Pony when I’m bored. It’s on the HUB channel if you are interested.

Why would you watch it on the hub if practically every single episode is on YouTube?

Read full topic

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I want to start a server, then I realize it will probably only get 12 year olds who will leave or ddos the fuck out of the vps if they don’t get mod and free shit, so I go rage at cod or watch mlp for a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @youridudock youridudock
item.description:
@youridudock wrote:

Same here, I could code for hole nights on my server. But now when I think “Lets code a server and host it” I login and after 15min I am doing something else

It happends to all of us.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Try to plan out what you could add to your server throughout the day. When you get to your computer, you can begin to add it and think about how it could be improved. Then you can improve anything else that you may think is shitty.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

You finally realized how boring RSPS can be… Welcome to the club, bro
[/quote]

pfft, quiter[/quote]
well, quitting whilst you’re ahead is better than producing shit code.

item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Creativity and imagination are things that I am seriously lacking when I code. Also motivation, although when I get a good idea I tend to want to get it finished.

In short; you need an idea.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

I feel the same way, you have to find the fun in coding, you have to find your creativity, know what i’m saying?
I hope I can help ;D

item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Try learning a new language.

I got bored of PHP, so I started to learn Java and it’s making me get my creativity back. I suggest maybe a web-based language such as what I started with.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Tree:

Also, avoid ‘RSPS’ bullshit. Move on to something better.

This. RSPS has stagnated severely over the past couple of years.

Read full topic
item.source: Why is this always happening to me?

item.title: Why is this always happening to me?
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

You don’t have a plan. I keep a large whiteboard above my desk and visually plan how i’m going to work on my project. This allows a sense of accomplishment as i write and a bit of direction. Also, avoid ‘RSPS’ bullshit. Move on to something better.

Read full topic

You finally realized how boring RSPS can be… Welcome to the club, bro

Lawl

Krackkid:

Maybe you should try to program instead of code it mite work better o.o

Suggestions?

[quote=“xEthanx, post:3, topic:443834”]How long were your breaks? The longer the better. Not just a few days, I suggest trying a few months.

Are you feeling stressed anywhere else? Bad work performance, relationships, etc?

Damn I should become a therapist[/quote]

I took monthly breaks.
